block.comment:
This block will setup the Ultrasonic sensor, which measures distance. It uses ultra-sonic sound waves to do this.
Below ---- is where you can set values that the virtual circuit will take in.
This block tells the Arduino which analog pin to use to use for sending data to the pixels. The analog pins are usually labeled with A1, A2, A2, etc.
This block allows you to send messages from the Arduino and the Arduino to send your computer messages.

The loop block runs on repeat until your Arduino loses power. It runs right after your setup block if you have one.
If you are using the simulator, you can control how many times it repeats.
It checks a condition using the if statement, executes a block of code if the condition is true, and otherwise executes the code inside the block when the condition is false.

Compares what is in the left and right holes and returns true or false.
If the operator =, it will check if both values are the same. If the operator ≠, it will check if both values are different.
Returns the number of centimeters the sensor sensed.

A for "count with block" creates a loop where it will stop looping once the variable has reached the "to" point. The best way to learn this block is to drag it out and play around with its values in the simulator.
This block will set the color of one led in your fastled light strip. This block uses 1 as the first pixel.
This block gets the value that the variable is storing. This variable store a number.
Use the block to display all RGB LED Strips

A for "count with block" creates a loop where it will stop looping once the variable has reached the "to" point. The best way to learn this block is to drag it out and play around with its values in the simulator.
This block will set the color of one led in your fastled light strip. This block uses 1 as the first pixel.
This block gets the value that the variable is storing. This variable store a number.
Use the block to display all RGB LED Strips
This block will send a message from the Arduino to the computer.

This block turns a number into a text block. The precision controls how many decimal places of the number will be turned into text.
Let’s say you have 5.23234, and you specify 2 for the precision. The text block that this block would return “5.23”.
Returns the number of centimeters the sensor sensed.
